title: Latest News: Gov. Brown Must Sign Historic Voting Bill, President Obama Can Stop Dark Money
text:
Featured Stories
Gov. Jerry Brown: Sign Historic Voting Bill California’s automatic registration bill could add nearly 7 million eligible voters to the rolls. But Gov. Jerry Brown needs to sign it first. Read Now »
What President Obama Can Do About Dark Money Right Now President Obama has an opportunity to combat dark money ahead of the 2016 election. Sign our petition and urge him to act now. Read Now »
The Top 3
A Bipartisan Justice Reform Bill Members of the U.S Senate Judiciary Committee reached agreement on a bipartisan bill that represents the most meaningful reform to our criminal justice system in a generation.
Closing Driver's License Offices in Alabama Alabama is planning to close 31 of its part-time driver’s license issuing offices across the state, which could make it harder for many to get the photo ID required to vote.
How Does Legal Change Happen in America? Is it necessary to first win in the court of public opinion before the court of law ? With case studies ranging from the victorious fight for marriage equality to partisan wrangling over the right to vote, reproductive freedom, the environment, and the death penalty, Legal Change shares remarkable accounts from decades of legal advocacy in America.
From Our Fellows
The Slave-State Origins of Modern Gun Rights The notion that citizens have a constitutional right to carry in public originates in the antebellum South. Eric Ruben explains.
The Roberts Court's Shameful Abandonment of Torture Victims By refusing to hear claims brought by victims of Bush-era torture and detention practices, the Roberts Court has abdicated its crucial oversight role and shut off one of the last remaining avenues for accountability, argues Dorothy Samuels.
The President in Prison While the reviews of HBO/Vice's special on criminal justice remain mixed, Obama's visit to federal prison would not have been imaginable even five years ago, writes Andrew Cohen.
Learn more about our fellows »
Featured Event
Give Us the Ballot: Book Talk with Ari Berman On Thursday, October 15, in New York City , the Brennan Center will host a talk with Ari Berman, discussing his new book, “Give Us the Ballot: The Modern Struggle for Voting Rights in America.” In this groundbreaking narrative history, Berman charts both the transformation of American democracy under the VRA and the counterrevolution that has sought to limit voting rights, from 1965 to the present day.
